etymology.description: semantic: 囗 ‘walled city’ + 啚 (early form of 鄙, ‘remote areas/territory’); simplified 啚 → 冬.
etymology.interpretation: An enclosure 囗 surrounds 啚, evoking a bounded territory, which extends to the sense of a map, picture, or plan of an area. In simplification, 啚 was replaced by the simpler 冬 to cut strokes while preserving the enclosed-area silhouette and meaning.
etymology.simplification: 啚 was replaced with the graphically simpler 冬 to reduce stroke count and ease writing; the change is shape-based rather than phonetic.

parts.english: remote areas; territory (early form of 鄙)

examples.chinese: 请看地图(請看地圖)，路线很清楚(路線很清楚)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng kàn dìtú, lùxiàn hěn qīngchǔ.
examples.english: Please look at the map; the route is very clear.

examples.chinese: 我画了一张图(我畫了一張圖)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ huà le yì zhāng tú.

examples.chinese: 我们按图施工(我們按圖施工)，计划如期完成(計劃如期完成)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen àn tú shīgōng, jìhuà rúqī wánchéng.
examples.english: We built according to the plan, and the project was completed on schedule.
